title: section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and, having obtained the
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Dún Laoghaire-
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Valuation Act 2001 (Dún Laoghaire-

Rathdown County Council) (Rate Limitation) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited valuation act 2001 (dun laoghaire- rathdown county council) (rate limitation) order 2023

title: section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and, having obtained the
heading: 2. Dún Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council shall exercise its powers to
text_raw:
2. Dún Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council shall exercise its powers to 
make such rates in such a manner as to secure that the total amount liable to be 
paid to it in respect of rates made by it for the local financial year 2024 does 
not exceed an amount determined in accordance with the formula set out in 
section 56(2) of the Valuation Act 2001, where “A” is the figure 1.064 and 
where “G” is €3,918,257. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
10 November, 2023. 

KIERAN O’DONNELL, 

Minister of State at the Department of Housing, Local 
Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 14th November, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [542] 3

title: section 56 of the Valuation Act 2001 (No. 13 of 2001) and, having obtained the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation). 

This Order requires that Dún Laoghaire-Rathdown County Council, in 
exercising its powers to make rates for the financial year 2024, does so in such 
a way to ensure that the total amount of rates liable to be paid to it does not 
exceed an amount determined in accordance with the formula as set out in 
section 56(2) of the Valuation Act 2001. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [542]
